Member Function Documentation

ValidateUtility::check ( $  how,
$  params 
)

checks the given values of the array match certain criterias

check(array( 'email'=>'INT' ),$this->params['form'])

Parameters:
array $how key/value pair. key is the name of the key inside the $what-array, value is a rule, the name of a function that is given the string (should return bool wether the string validates)
array $params the actual data as name=>value array (eg. $this->params['form'])
Returns:
true if data validates OR $params-key, for example 'EMAIL' if no correct email given OR false if $params is empty

$  params 
)

checks the given values of the array match certain criterias

check(array( 'email'=>'INT' ),$this->params['form'])

Parameters:
array $how key/value pair. key is the name of the key inside the $what-array, value is a rule, the name of a function that is given the string (should return bool wether the string validates)
array $params the actual data as name=>value array (eg. $this->params['form'])
Returns:
true if data validates OR $params-key, for example 'EMAIL' if no correct email given OR array() if $params is empty

$  params 
)

check the given parameter-array against the rows of a model

Parameters:
string $modelname name of the model to validate against
array $params the actual data as name=>value array (eg. $this->params['form'])
Returns:
